TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , who is a lawyer and former member of ORG ) , lives in PERSON ( GPE of GPE ) . At the material time he was an advocate acting as defence counsel for PERSON who had been placed in detention pending trial ( ORG ) on suspicion of committing a number of thefts .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr S. ’s wife informed PERSON that the CARDINAL district clerks ( Amtsschreiber ) of the NORP district authority ( PERSON ) had urged her to instruct a different lawyer to defend her husband if he wished to be released .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant then held a press conference in his office in GPE at which he declared that at the NORP district authority offices both the laws of the GPE of GPE and human rights were flagrantly disregarded , and had been for DATE ( werden sowohl die PERSON als auch die ORG in höchstem Grade verletzt , und zwar schon PERSON ) . He pointed out that he was speaking to the press because it was his last resort ( deshalb bleibt mir nur noch der Weg über die GPE ) .
CARDINAL . The following day the DATE newspaper ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) published the following article ( at page CARDINAL ) :
“ Former ORG ( ORG ) councillor demands investigation into NORP district authority
‘ I wo n’t let those gentlemen make a fool of me any longer’
Former ORG councillor PERSON makes serious accusations against the NORP district authority .

‘ I ’ve had enough of letting those gentlemen at the NORP district authority make a fool of NORP thundered PERSON . ‘ So the only recourse left to me is to take the matter to the press.’ The former ORG councillor was prompted to take the unusual step of approaching the public during pending proceedings on account of a case entrusted to him as a lawyer in DATE . At that time his client had already been in pre - trial detention at the NORP district authority prison for DATE .
Detained without an arrest warrant

The DATE father of a DATE daughter was arrested on CARDINAL DATE with his brother for the theft of car radios and clothes , and released after admitting the offences . When , on DATE , he went to the GPE cantonal police to ask how his brother was , he was again immediately arrested .

‘ When I enquired at the NORP district authority about the arrest warrant , I was told that the order had been issued to him orally’ said PERSON , who sees the conduct of the police as a clear breach of the cantonal LAW , Article CARDINAL of which provides : ‘ The arrest shall be carried out by the police , duly authorised by a written warrant of arrest.’

When these accusations were put to him , the PERSON prefect [ Mr H. B. ] was giving nothing away . ‘ Where I ’m in charge nobody is arrested without a written arrest warrant’ , he said . ‘ I can not say any more about a pending case.’ On the other hand , PERSON , who was asked by the accused ’s wife to defend her husband , will not remain silent any longer : ‘ The wife came to me because the lawyer appointed under the legal aid scheme had still not contacted his client even though he had been in pre - trial detention for CARDINAL weeks.’

Schöpfer immediately contacted the officially appointed counsel who handed the case over to him . However , the NORP district authority did not want PERSON to take over as defence counsel under the legal aid scheme and refused his request on CARDINAL DATE on the ground that there were no reasons to dismiss the lawyer to whom the case had been assigned until then . He was , however , free to represent his client on a private basis .
Schöpfer as the ground for detention ?

The last straw for PERSON came when the accused ’s wife informed him DATE that [ T.B. ] and [ PERSON ] , the CARDINAL district clerks , had advised her not to keep him on the case . ‘ They told GPE she confirmed for the ORG , ‘ that my husband would not be released as long as PERSON remained his defence counsel.’ But [ T.B. ] denied any involvement : ‘ That ’s ridiculous . I never said anything like that . [ PERSON ] can confirm that . He was present when I spoke with the man ’s wife.’

PERSON will not let the matter drop : ‘ I demand the immediate resignation of the prefect and the district clerks and a thorough investigation of the case by an impartial commission of inquiry from outside the canton.’ ”
In a box inside the article was the following text :
“ Accusations

It is not the first time that serious charges have been levelled against the NORP district authority . Prefect [ PERSON ] was previously prosecuted in connection with the conviction of [ GPE ] , the ORG debt collection officer [ PERSON ] . He was fined MONEY by ORG for disclosure of official secrets . Although ORG also found that the objective elements of the offence had been made out , [ PERSON ] was acquitted on appeal . ”

The article was illustrated by CARDINAL photographs , CARDINAL showing the NORP district authority building and the other Prefect PERSON with the caption : “ Where I ’m in charge nobody is arrested without a written arrest warrant ( Bei mir wird niemand ohne schriftlichen PERSON festgehalten ) . ”

CARDINAL . Another DATE newspaper , ORG , also published , on DATE , an article on the press conference under the title : “ PERSON man arrested without a warrant ? GPE lawyer accuses NORP district authority of breaking the law ( PERSON ohne PERSON verhaftet ? PERSON wirft PERSON ) . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor ’s office ( Staatsanwaltschaft ) of the GPE of GPE issued a reply to the effect that the accused person concerned had been arrested in accordance with the law , and that the applicant had not filed an appeal against the refusal to allow him to take over as the officially appointed defence counsel . This reply was published in the press on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG published a summary of a press communiqué issued by the applicant in reply to the public prosecutor ’s statement . According to PERSON , PERSON ’s arrest had breached both the Convention and – “ in a crude and unacceptable manner ( in absolut grober und nicht mehr zu verantwortender PERSON ) ” – the cantonal LAW . The applicant also quoted the following passage from a letter he had received from another lawyer : “ The situation in PERSON is far from satisfactory ... What makes it even worse is the fact that the judicial authorities know what is going on in PERSON and even make indirect allusions to the situation . ” In conclusion , PERSON called on ORG and ORG to look into the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant had lodged applications for the release of PERSON ) , which the PERSON prefect refused on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .

PERSON lodged an appeal ( PERSON ) against the last of these decisions . This was dismissed by ORG ) of the GPE of GPE on DATE , on the ground , among others , that the prefect had subsequently validly extended PERSON pre - trial detention , so that PERSON no longer had standing to bring an action challenging the conditions of his arrest . It noted , however , that after his arrest PERSON should have been brought , not before a district clerk , but before the prefect himself , the only person who could be considered a judge or other officer for the purposes of LAW . It therefore ordered that its decision should be brought to the attention of the public prosecutor ’s office , which was the prefect ’s supervisory authority ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Aufsichtsbehörde über die Rechtsanwälte ) informed PERSON that his conduct raised certain ethical questions , relating in particular to the need for discretion ( PERSON ) with regard to pending proceedings and to covert publicity , and asked him what he had to say on the matter .
In a letter of DATE which he communicated to the press , the applicant replied that he had acted only in the general interest and in that of his client .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON prefect had lodged a complaint ( ORG ) with ORG and asked for disciplinary proceedings to be brought against PERSON . He asserted that by his statements the latter had not only slandered the prefect and his CARDINAL district clerks but had also been guilty of a serious breach of lawyers’ professional ethics ( ORG ) by spreading false accusations through the media rather than making use of the available legal remedies .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG brought disciplinary proceedings against the applicant .
On DATE , pursuant to LAW ( PERSON ) of the GPE of GPE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , it fined him MONEY ( CHF ) for a breach of professional ethics ( PERSON und Standespflichten ) .

In its decision ORG observed in particular that the applicant had omitted to refer his complaints DATE which were serious – in the first place to the public prosecutor ’s office or ORG , which were the relevant supervisory bodies for the district authority . He had therefore failed to observe the discretion which lawyers were required to maintain , in public , with regard to pending proceedings . In addition , he had engaged in covert publicity ( versteckte Reklame ) and cheap showmanship ( Effekthascherei ) , thus demonstrating that he was more concerned about his own public profile than about the merits of the case . In any event , ORG statements to the press always had to be not only of real public interest ( reelles öffentliches ORG ) but also objective and moderate in tone ( objektiv in der Darstellung und sachlich i m Ton ) .

But the tone of a number of passages in PERSON statements to the press left something to be desired . For example he had said : “ I wo n’t let those gentlemen make a fool of me any longer ” and “ I demand … a thorough investigation of the case by an impartial commission of inquiry from outside the canton ” and also “ So the only recourse left to me is to take the matter to the press . ” This last statement was not even true , since at that time PERSON had not even applied to the relevant supervisory bodies for the district authority , nor had he tried exercising the ordinary legal remedies . He had thus disparaged not only the NORP district authority but all the GPE ’s judicial authorities , which was incompatible with a lawyer ’s professional ethics .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a public - law appeal against the above decision . This was dismissed by ORG on DATE .

It observed that lawyers enjoyed considerable freedom to criticise the judicial authorities , provided that this was done according to the correct procedures , and in the first place in the course of representing and defending their clients . When , however , a lawyer appealed to public opinion , he was under a duty , like any other person employed in the service of justice , to refrain from any conduct inconducive to the proper administration thereof . LAW also enunciated the principle that interference could be justified if its purpose was to maintain the authority and impartiality of the judiciary . Admittedly , there might be circumstances in which the public interest required alleged violations of constitutional or human rights to be made public . In order to determine whether that was the case , it was necessary to ascertain how obvious the alleged violations were , whether pending proceedings were likely to be influenced , whether the available remedies had been exercised and in what form the criticism had been made .

In the instant case PERSON had been punished not so much for denouncing human rights violations as for the way in which he had done so . When considering the case ORG had indeed taken into account the fact that one of the complaints raised by the applicant , concerning the fact that Mr S. had been brought before a district clerk rather than the prefect , had subsequently been upheld by ORG . However , Mr PERSON ’s other criticisms DATE which were likely to influence pending proceedings – had been found by ORG to be unjustified . Furthermore , ORG had ruled that the applicant had not employed the right tone in his criticism and that he had made untrue allegations . It had given sufficient grounds for its decision and the applicant had not adduced any convincing counter - arguments .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Statute of the Bar ( PERSON ) of the GPE of GPE establishes a ORG ( Aufsichtsbehörde über die GPE ) whose members – CARDINAL judges of ORG , CARDINAL administrative court judge and CARDINAL lawyers DATE are appointed by ORG for DATE . Under LAW has jurisdiction to investigate lawyers’ breaches of professional ethics ( Berufs- und Standespflichten ) and may impose disciplinary penalties . Under LAW these range from a reprimand ( PERSON ) to temporary or permanent disbarment , with fines of MONEY CARDINAL,CARDINAL as intermediate penalties .
